intro: Pyrola convoluta, commonly known as the curled yellow wintergreen, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the northeastern United States and eastern Canada. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants such as blueberries and azaleas. The plant has dark green, leathery leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are small, bell-shaped, and typically pink or white, appearing in late winter to early spring. Pyrola convoluta thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
